page.title: 01WINCANTON-QUEEN OF THE VALE
page.content: { Wincanton(pop.3380)}is on the gentle hills which enclose the northern end of the Blackmore Vale. The{River Cale} flows through the western edge of the town. Wincanton ={Wyn Cale Ton}or Farm on the White Cale River. The{A303 trunk road}from London to the S.W. used to go through the town until a bypass opened in 1977.{A roads run from N.to S.(Bristol to the south coast).{B roads}go S.W. to Sherborne & N.W. past the race-course to Bruton. The town centre consists largely of 18th & 19th century{stone buildings, } including some fine{coaching inns.}The churches & chapels are mainly C19th. {Carrington Way}contains the modern Old People's Home, Library, Health Centre, Police Station & the shops & offices of the new{Camelot Centre.}Since 1920 many Council homes, & in the last 20 years,private estates have been built.
